title: Grilled Thinly Sliced Pork Marinated in Chile Paste (Cecina Enchilada)
ingredients: 1 pound boneless pork loin, thinly sliced
6 to 7 chiles guajillos, stemmed, seeded and deveined
1 piece of Mexican cinnamon, about 1 inch long
½ cup fruit or cider vinegar
½ teaspoon salt, or to taste
instructions: Heat 2 cups of water in a medium size saucepan.   When the water is hot but not boiling soak the chiles for 10 minutes.  Reserve the water.  On a 10-inch dry comal, griddle, or in a cast-iron frying pan, toast the peppercorns, allspice, clove, cinnamon, and oregano.

Put the cleaned chiles, spices, garlic, vinegar, salt, and ½ cup of the chile water in a blender and blend well.  Spread the paste over the pieces of meat and let it sit for 1 to 2 hours.  (However, this marinating can be done overnight.)
Grill the meat over hot coals or sear on a cast-iron griddle (or in the George Foreman Grilling Machine).  Garnish the grilled meat with green onions and serve with hot corn tortillas.
source: Seasons of My Heart, A Culinary Journey Through Oaxaca, Mexico by Susana Trilling, published by The Ballantine Publishing Group, © 1999 by Susana Trilling.
